title: Potato

nouns: A tuberous plant, Solanum tuberosum, often eaten as a starchy vegetable, particularly in the Americas and Europe.
A plant tuber, Solanum tuberosum, eaten as a starchy vegetable, particularly in the Americas and Europe
An edible tuber native to South America; a staple food of Ireland
The potato is a starchy, tuberous crop from the perennial nightshade Solanum tuberosum L. The word "potato" may refer either to the plant itself or the edible tuber.
In culinary terms, a vegetable is an edible plant or its part, intended for cooking or eating raw.
A plant raised for some edible part of it.
Edible seeds or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous plant
Edible plant or part of a plant
A nutritional and culinary term that denotes any part of a plant that is commonly consumed by humans as food.
Any of various herbaceous plants having parts that are used as food.
The edible part of such a plant.
Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

description: A whole potato—such as a russet, used for baking, mashing, or frying—shown with a few eyes on its golden-brown skin. Not to be confused with the roasted sweet potato.
apple_vendor_description: The potato emoji on Apple devices is a perfectly rendered, earthy brown tuber, showcasing Apple's commitment to realistic textures and subtle shading. Its slightly irregular, rounded shape is presented with a tactile quality, as if you could almost feel its starchy surface, thanks to the glossy 3D effect and soft highlights. This humble emoji, with its grounded and wholesome appearance on Apple devices, symbolizes nourishment, simple pleasures, and the foundational elements of a meal, often used in discussions about food or comfort.
